summary: January is the first month of the year in the Julian and Gregorian calendars, coming between December  and February .
full_text: January  is the first month of the year in the Julian and Gregorian calendars and one of seven months with the length of 31 days. The first day of the month is known as New Year's Day. It is, on average, the coldest month of the year within most of the Northern Hemisphere  and the warmest month of the year within most of the Southern Hemisphere . In the Southern hemisphere, January is the seasonal equivalent of July in the Northern hemisphere and vice versa.
title: January
